data.title: Okay but nothing to write home about
data.text: I stopped by to satisfy a craving for a typical NJ sub sandwich. I remember the days when Frills occupied that space. In those days the subs were the best.  Much to my dismay the meat for my sandwich was pre-sliced which made me wonder how fresh it really was.   After eating it I felt a bit queasy.  I would imagine that they need to cut corners due to all the students who frequent their establishment on a daily basis.

data.title: Just odd!!
data.text:
Been getting subs here since this place was Frills, so I know a bit about the place.
Subs are still good.  Place is kinda dirty. Owner is a total oddball.
Every time I go in he just gets odder and odder.
When I walked in today for two subs to go, he was talking to the kid who works for him, who was in the back with him cleaning up.  He was looking at the kid, in a totally different direction than where I was, and in mid sentence to the kid he says, can I help you?
I hear him but can't imagine why he wouldn't look at the person he is addressing.  After a four or five second pause, while he is still looking at the kid, I said, are you talking to me?
He says no, I'm talking to the guy who came in behind you!  There was nobody behind me.
I said that in this country, people who speak English normally look at the person they are speaking to unless they are ignorant or rude.   This didn't get a response.   Nobody said anything for a few seconds.
So I order a ham, salami and provolone sub.  He says, I don't have any bologna, I said I didn't order any bologna.  This went on two more times until the kid told him I didn't order bologna, but a number one sub.
I got the sub and left.
Subs are good, guy is a complete wacko!   Just nuts!      Keeps complaining that Jersey Mikes stole his sub recipe!   Imagine!

data.title: STILL a favorite....
data.text: Been going there for over 30+ years......still the best sub around!!!  Locals have been loving these sandwiches for a LONG time....

data.title: Service with a smile
data.text: Troops never disappoints. I usually go for the cold subs, which are always made to perfection. Favorite: #2. The gentlemen at the counter are always so pleasant and courteous. Go for takeout, not the ambiance.

data.title: . Best subs in NNJ
data.text: Hole in the wall but a Clifton classic. best subs anywhere. I esp like the hot roast beef. The setting is run down and can appear dirty, but it is great eats

data.title: Used to be Frills!
data.text: My friends and I have been getting subs from this place for40 years, back when it was called Frills.  The place still makes good subs.  The current owner is a crusty fart however so don't expect any pleasantries.  If he says anything it is to say how he "invented" the formula that made Jersey Mikes subs successful!  Place is kind dirty too.

data.title: Old school quality. Reliable and always tasty!
data.text:
I moved into the area recently from NYC and some quick research showed this as the best local shop for sandwiches.  I've now ordered from here several times and will be coming back whenever I can.  Bear in mind that I've only ever ordered subs from this shop so I cannot comment on their other items.

The roast beef is always cooked a perfect medium rare and their bread is always soft and fresh.  The owner and his staff are courteous and efficient and they seem like they've been at it for years. I have family that lives near the Tastee Sub shops in Edison and South Brunswick and I've always regarded those as my favorite sandwich shops in NJ.  This place comes really close.

The shop itself is modest and has a very old-school feel to it. You come here for the sandwiches and not for the atmosphere.

data.title: Delicious Sandwiches in a friendly place
data.text: This place has been in Clifton a long time- and there is a reason for that. Went there for the first time on a recomendation- the sandwiches cant be beat- excellent and executed by a fast and friendly staff. Have been back several times and it is consistantly good. Now GO !!

data.title: Don't touch anything; use a hand sanitizer at the door when you leave
data.text:
I went for the dogs.......I try different places for hot dogs.
These, by far, had to be the worst, including the buns.
The buns literally fell apart as they were that cheap, and were refrigerated.
Do not look down at the floor; it is filthy.
Do not look behind the counter; it is filthy.
The Owner takes drags on his cigarette out the back door; places it on a ledge, and grabs
drags in between fixings sandwiches.
The locals seem to like the sandwiches as these are the items that move;
Frankly, I will never return and can think of many other Delis to get sandwiches from.
The one broken stool has been that way for years;
The outside of the building is in need of some serious maintenance.
Stay away.

data.title: Crappy Place very dirty
data.text: The grounds around the building are always dirty and ridden with trash. The condition of the building is poor, windows on the second floor are boarded up, the paint is peeling off and the parking is horrible. When you get inside, the owner can be found smoking cigarettes in the hallway. I don't know about you but I hate smokers, let alone touch my food. A complete turnoff. The place is very outdated, maybe if he fixed the place up and maintained it he would get more business. Also heard from other people that he doesn't always pass health inspection.

data.title: Always made to your specifications - not how they think it should be. Wonderful recommendations as well.
data.text: Always made to your specifications - not how they think it should be. Wonderful recommendations as well.

data.title: They definitely make great subs, but then you smell like the place for the rest of the day. It's a worthwhile sacrifice...
data.text: They definitely make great subs, but then you smell like the place for the rest of the day. It's a worthwhile sacrifice most of the time... and their wings rule, too.
